Package doa.engine.scene

Class DoaScene

java.lang.Object
doa.engine.scene.DoaScene
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DoaScene extends Object implements Serializable
Responsible for keeping DoaObjects. A scene is composed of zero or more DoaObjects. DoaObjects can be added to a scene only by invoking add(DoaObject) and passing an existing DoaObject.

For a DoaObject to have a contribution to the image on the screen, the DoaObject has to be in the loaded scene. DoaScenes are loaded via DoaSceneHandler.loadScene(DoaScene).
Since:
DoaEngine 1.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Doga Oruc
See Also:

    • add

      public void add​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaObject o)
      Adds the specified DoaObject to this scene.
      Parameters:

    • remove

      public void remove​(@NotNull @NotNull DoaObject o)
      Schedules the removal of the specified DoaObject from this scene. This method schedules the object for removal, the removal will take place in the start of next tick.
      Parameters:
      o - object to remove from this scene

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(DoaObject o)
      Checks if the specified DoaObject (or UI component) is inside this scene. More formally, returns true if and only if this scene contains an element e such that Objects.equals(o, e).
      Parameters:
      o - object to remove from this scene
      Returns:
      true if this scene contains an element e such that Objects.equals(o, e)

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Removes ALL of the DoaObjects from this scene. The scene will be empty after this method returns.
